meanings.definition: Disgusting or unpleasant in taste or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The food looked yukky and made me feel sick.
meanings.sent2: I don't like the taste of that yukky medicine.
meanings.sent3: The yukky smell coming from the garbage can was unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The pond was covered in a yukky green algae.
meanings.sent5: The yukky mold on the bread was a sign it was too old to eat.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of disgust or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The movie had some yukky scenes that made me look away.
meanings.sent2: The slimy texture of the snail was really yukky.
meanings.sent3: The yukky prank played on him left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The yukky truth about the situation was finally revealed.
meanings.sent5: The yukky taste of the spoiled milk lingered in his mouth.

meanings.sent1: The weather turned yukky with dark clouds and rain.
meanings.sent2: The yukky feeling of wet socks squishing in my shoes is the worst.
meanings.sent3: The yukky sound of nails on a chalkboard always gives me shivers.
meanings.sent4: The yukky task of cleaning the bathroom is never fun.
meanings.sent5: The yukky sensation of a cold draft made her shiver.
